answers.answer: Wonderful to hear! Good luck - your baby will be here before you know it! My baby #2 will be 2 weeks tomorrow...amazing how fast time flies!

Congrats Jackie.. and Im gonna use this forum as a celebration for me too.We only got to BD 3 days before ovulation and it was in a front seat of a car and most of the "stuff" fell right out!  AND LOOK WHAT I GOT!!!http://i25.photobucket.com/albums/c63/Tashalu00/tasha001.jpgAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!Now lets just hope this one sticks around.
CONGRATULATIONS to both of you!that is hilarious it was the front seat of the car, most fell out, and it still worked. nice going! how long were you ttc?
YAY!!!  I'm still waiting on the results of my 3 hour...i've been on pins and needles since i took it.  Keep your fingers crossed for me.
We have been TTC for over 2 years.. and we have both male and female fertility issues.  HA!  Imagine that!

Well, shoot! I guess that just goes to show the rest of us (unsuccessfully ttc for 15 mo) that we need to ENJOY ourselves more instead of treating it like a job (bd'ing on schedule, certain positions, etc.). I am so excited for you!

question: Hey everyone, sorry to take up a post, but I am so excited that I past my glucose test. I had gestational diabetes with my son and I felt horrible at times! This is my second pregnancy and All is clear. Just wanted to share the good news! I am 29.5 weeks!
title: I PAST THE GLUCOSE TEST!!! Open Forum as well
